runs.comm: as you'd expect, there's bounce and carry for Tsotsobe straight away. Unexpectedly, Warner just had a look at let this one go outside off. I'm sure we won't see too much more of that
ouch! Tsotsobe steams in and hits the seam, nipping one sharply back into Warner and striking him amidships
landing on a good length outside off. Warner steps half forward and defends to point
hurled down the leg side, and Australia's first run of the innings comes from a wide
Warner looked to come forward at the bowler but Tsotsobe responded with a nippy bouncer ... unfortunately for him, he dug it in a little too short and that's another wide
yet more seam movement for Tsotsobe, and Warner collects a leg bye and a stinging blow to the upper thigh
great, probing delivery, but well-played by Wade. It reared at him outside off but he took the bottom hand off the bat and rode the bounce to get the ball down towards gully
tight bowling to end the over, Tsotsobe maintaining his line and length outside off. Wade defends
a massive swipe! Warner was looking to launch this one into the stands beyond midwicket, but there was daylight between bat and ball as he swung at it
pushed wide across the left-hander, who decides to let this one go
full and straight from Morkel. Warner whips off the pads, but finds the man at square leg

the slower ball almost does for Warner! Morkel pulled his length back and sent this one down at just over 120kph. Warner was too early into his defence and popped the ball back, but it dropped short of the bowler

gone this time! Warner slashes at a length delivery, slicing under the ball and sending it looping towards mid off ... where the fielder charges in and holds a good, sliding catch. Two ducks in two games for Warner
a splice-jarring delivery! Both Morkel and Tsotsobe have found pleasing life in this surface. This one rose sharply outside off, but was played with soft hands down to third man
pitched up outside off, and it's defended to cover point
a slashing cut this time! It's struck hard, but quite fine and Morkel slides across to stop it at third man
Tsotsobe lands one on a good length just outside off to get Marsh propping half-forward in defence
seam and bounce! Marsh had to hurriedly fend this one of his ribs, taking one hand off the bat as he did so, but managed to get it to fine leg
good fielding off his own bowling. A full delivery was driven hard back down the pitch but Tsotsobe bent down quickly to stop it
chopped down to third man, the ball rising off a length once more
Morkel loses his direction just a touch, pushing this one down the leg side
fuller and straighter from the lanky fast bowler, and it's driven straight back at him
Morkel aims for a slower-ball yorker, but it's dug it just wide of mid on for a single
aimed at the top of off, and Marsh pushes bat and pad together in defence
another good stop by Amla at mid on. Marsh timed a clip off his pads but Amal sprinted across and slid to keep them to a single

shot! Wade has settled in on this bouncy track, and indeed uses the lift off the wicket to great effect here, slamming a rising delivery outside off over point with a scything cut. That never got up very high but flew over the boundary
fuller from Morkel, and Wade comes forward to drive to mid off
pushed gently into the off side for one
Wade steps to the pitch and drives well, but pings the man at extra cover. Good shot for no runs

edged and gone! Wade charged the bowler and slashed at a length delivery, but didn't factor in the extra bounce and could only send a healthy edge through to Kuhn. This is turning into a bit of a top-order wobble now
chopped to point defensively, Hussey thought about a cheaky single but was rightfully sent back
a testing length yet again from Tsotsobe, and he keeps Hussey in his crease and defending
a hint of width offered as the ball is slanted across the right-hander, but his backfoot punch is stopped at cover point

well, he's promptly dispatched to the midwicket boundary! Parnell charged to the crease with some hustle and slung one down at good pace, but slipped towards Marsh's pads and the batsman put him away with balance and timing

six over cover! Good pace again from Parnell, but he offers width outside off and Marsh doesn't hold back, the ball landing beyond the cover boundary. Perhaps I should have called Parnell a batsman who bowls a bit?
that's better from the left-armer. Parnell goes a little fuller and Marsh is beaten slashing outside off
nasty delivery! Parnell pulled his length back a touch and aimed this one at Marsh's throat. The batsman played it well, though, dropping his hands and swaying back as the ball rushed up at him
angled down through gully for one
Hussey aims to drive a length delivery back past the bowler, but it's cleanly stopped
not the best start, Theron pushing this one down the leg side
well stopped! Theron offered width on the other side of the wicket, and Marsh nailed the cut, but Duminy got right behind it at point
nudged away for a quick single on the leg side
good fielding again, this time it's Morkel at mid on. He had to rush to his left as Hussey drove with some timing, but managed to keep them to one

a direct hit would've had him! Hussey pushed a tip-and-run single towards point, the fielder sprinted in and threw underarm, but couldn't hit the stumps. Marsh was a couple of yards short as the ball passed the stumps
Marsh loses his shape in a massive mow outside off, and unsurprisingly doesn't come close to hitting it
beaten once again! Theron dug this one in a little shorter, drawing extra bounce off the surface to beat the top edge of Marsh's pull
a fortuitous inside edge! Hussey tried to fetch this into the leg side from outside off, but the ball took the inside edge and burst between the batsman and his stumps. Not too far away at all ...
slashed down through backward point, third man sprinting round
South Africa have been superbly energetic in the field so far, and Duminy once again does well to stop Marsh's push at backward point and put the batsman under pressure with a shy at the stumps
the slower ball bouncer from Parnell, not quite picked by Marsh. He was too early into his shot, inside edging into his body
crack! Pitched up by Parnell, and absolutely thrashed through cover by Marsh. He didn't move his feet much, but the connection was ominously good

huge! Too full again by Parnell, and Marsh sends the ball sailing over wide long on with a great strike. Parnell's not having the greatest day out there. He can always come back with the bat though, that's what's great about being an allrounder ...
slog swept to deep midwicket! Hussey allows Botha no time to settle, bending into a powerful shot that couldn't be hauled in by the sliding boundary rider
nurdled into the leg side for a single, played with the spin
driven uppishly to extra cover! Dropping short of the fielder there
well bowled by Botha, who spotted Marsh backing away to leg and followed him with the arm ball
speared down straight and very full, Marsh can only dig it out to cover
pitched up again, but the line is a little off and he's worked wide of midwicket for one

well-caught by Kuhn! Marsh aimed to heave Theron's first delivery over midwicket but sliced under the ball. The swirling chance came down somewhere near backward point, where Kuhn had charged and called for it. There's a slight delay as the umpire checks for the no-ball, and though it's very tight the delivery is legitimate and Marsh is on his way. That's put a dent in Australia's fightback
driven on the up through extra cover, and out to the sweeper
White is off the mark first ball, whipping uppishly but into space out at long leg
Theron hits a length outside off, and he's guided down to third man for one
an attempted bouncer from Theron, but he's not got the pace to trouble White, even on this fast, bouncy track. White just swivelled onto the back foot and sent the ball racing to deep backward square
the slower ball is deposited into the crowd beyond wide long on! White is wasting no time here. That was a fantastic pick-up, right out of the middle
opens the face and guides this through backward point
a touch slower, White comes onto the front foot and works with the turn into the leg side
big wicket for South Africa! Hussey has picked out long on...used his feet to Botha but didn't quite get the connection and was a well-judged catch near the boundary
onto the front foot, takes an inside edge towards square leg
quicker ball speared in towards the pads, half an appeal but going well down leg
worked down the ground and long on is quickly round to prevent a second
on off stump, defended with bat and pad together
thumping shot. Hint of width, but it wasn't a half volley and White threw his hands through the line sending it racing through mid-off
pushed into the off side
sharp bouncer from Morkel, White gets a combination of glove then helmet and the ball loops in front of the keeper
flicked to deep square leg
opens the face to find third man
tossed up on the stumps and worked down the ground
outside off but again it goes down to long on with a wristy flick
same again, working with the hint of turn down to long on
four in a row down the ground on the on side
ah, something different, speared down the leg side
back to normality as the batsman works a straight delivery down to long on
poor line this time and it's flicked very fine past the keeper although short fine-leg is able to chase it down
slashed down to third man although it was meant to go more over cover
that has gone miles in the air, but doesn't reach the boundary. Smith went straight, managed to clear mid-on as he back-tracked then it plugged on the outfield
driven through the off side
pushed down to long off
another goes and Tsotsobe deserved that. Smith tries to work a slower ball off-cutter to the leg side and gets a leading edge to cover for a simple catch
defends his first ball in international cricket to cover and has a big task ahead of him
driven off a thick outside edge to short third man
oh dear! That's a shocker. It was a gentle drive through the covers but Morkel has let it through his legs at long off. Oops
low full toss which is flicked down to long on
pushed square on the off side
very full, drilled hard into the pitched and it bounces over Botha's out-stretched hand...the throw hits the stumps direct and almost costs an extra run
worked off the pads to midwicket. It's a tight run, but they scamper home
Theron back into the attack and his first delivery is chopped to backward point
angled down to third man
another leading edge but this one clears extra cover and runs down to long off
dragged down a touch short but the batsman doesn't connect and only finds midwicket
that's some good timing, it was a slower ball and White chips it down the ground with plenty of bottom hand to split the deep fielders
good yorker to finish with which is dug out to midwicket
stands outside leg stump then uses the angle to glide the ball down to third man
third man in action again
back of a length, doesn't come off the surface with much pace and White can't really time it down the ground

football meets cricket! Excellent skills from Parnell in his follow through. Marsh got an inside edge into his pads which bobbled down by his feet. White called for the single, but Parnell sprinted from his follow through and kicked the ball into the stumps
pushed off the back foot out to deep cover
driven down the ground to long off
can't beat backward point as he punches square
subtle change of pace and it beats Marsh as he uses his feet
chopped hard into the ground and it bounces over backward point down to third man
offers up some width and it's nicely cut away to deep point where the sweeper can't stop a second
pushed down the leg side and that'll give Australia an extra delivery

slashes outside off stump and gets a thin edge through to the keeper. Australia just can't build momentum in this innings. The umpires check for the no-ball, but this Theron has half his foot behind the line.
inside edge into the pads and point sprints in to prevent a single
that's gone the distance. A mighty blow from Marsh as he launches a back-of-a-length delivery over wide long on
flicked off the pads and now there's a misfield at short fine-leg
gives himself room to try and flay through the off side but only gets an edge into his boot
short of a length and this time the No. 9 latches on with a sweetly struck pull which races through midwicket
driven down the ground
low full toss, comes off an outside edge through the covers
good yorker, Marsh has a big swing and it comes off an inside edge out to deep square
a little gem of an innings from Marsh as he crashes a full toss straight down the ground over long on...that's not an easy thing to do
swing and a miss this time
and another! This time he goes over extra cover. That's a superb shot as stands on leg stump and drives inside out with excellent timing

take that! That...is...massive. Even for Jo'burg that's huge. Wrong length from Morkel - on a good length - and Marsh is able to get underneath the ball and swing it miles into the stands at deep midwicket
finally on target. A yorker extracts off stump as Marsh tries to guide it through the off side but not after some significant damage was done
